CatDescriptText: Mr. John Charles, 1822 Cliff Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 29, 1958, pg.2 with question: "Do people, whom you know, place more emphasis on social life than civic responsibilities?" answer reads: "The people today are trying to be 'somebody' other than themselves, and therefore they are not doing anything for the community."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John Charles, wearing mustache, eyeglasses, dark button down jacket with plaid collar, arms, and breast pockets, and dark hat with light colored band, holding shopping bag inscribed "style leaders wear Flagg Bros....", standing in front of concrete wall, right store window displaying mens dress shirts
